content: Alvin Toffler Saw Demassification As Inevitable Tribal self-segregation is the norm, unfortunately. In protracted conversations with Alvin about demassification issue was, as you say, “building new infrastructures for connection where people have a purpose.” Those haven’t been built. But, when you say, “If we want to develop a healthy democracy, we need a diverse and highly connected social fabric,” you neglect to note we don’t have a democracy — indeed most believe its a medieval plutocracy. (see my, Doc Says — Our Emotions, Institutions and Technological Capabilities Are Mismatched, Civilization’s Anti-Human, Not Machines and or Our Twilight Zone & What Comes Next *) When you say, “American public wants to have strong connections across divisions. They see the value politically and socially. But they’re not going to work for it….This is the conundrum we now face,” you are spot on. Thus, the real need is for a new institution outside the existing political system. One that’s independent, nonpartisan and dynamically representative in a realistic, multidimensional way focused on agenda setting and issues, not careers and money. One that’s able over time to develop sufficient trust and credibility that it can leverage formal institutions.(see my, One Story the Media Ignores Completely, Missing The Vision Thing, We Don’t Need Another Hero, and or A New Process to Fix Our Political System) Short of creating such a new institution we’re toast (see my, Our Human Stain and Only 6 Possible Outcomes in Next 20 Years [ — 4 are Bad — ]) Doc Huston
